term.title: re-extraction

item.text: Since the prefix 're' can signify 'back' as well as 'again' this term is ambiguous and should be avoided, except where the process of extraction(e.g. from aqueous solution to an organic phase) in a single direction is repeated (following stripping). It should not be used as a synonym for stripping or back-extraction.

sources.item: PAC, 1993, 65, 2373. 'Nomenclature for liquid-liquid distribution (solvent extraction) (IUPAC Recommendations 1993)' on page 2379 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199365112373)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
